Class GUISerialPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • GUISerialPort

  • public class GUISerialPort
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper class for jssc's SerialPort; gets all data from wireless serial connection. GUILayeredPane calls update() method at a set interval, which updates the data[] array, then GUI components are free to call getData() when they need to without causing confliction serial commands. Conversion to ints/ scaling is done in update(). tempData[] is used to store information as it is being converted for use in GUI so that a call to getData() won't return a partially updated array. sendGoalCoors() currently unimplemented in GUI, but available for when camera is set up.

    • Field Detail

      • port

        private static SerialPort port
        SerialPort object that is wrapped by this class

      • bb

        private static java.nio.ByteBuffer bb
        Used to read byte stream

      • RADIUS

        private static final double RADIUS
        Used to convert angular velocity to linear velocity for the speedometer. This is an approximation since the distance from the center of rotation will change for a double pendulum, but it will do for display purposes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • floatHolder

        private static float[] floatHolder
        Holds initial floats from byte conversion

      • tempData

        private static int[] tempData
        Holds float values converted to ints and scaled while all processing occurs (see class comments).

      • data

        private static int[] data
        Holds final values to send for drawing; returned by update().

      • sending

        private static boolean sending
        True if port is trying to send data rather than recieve it (only used for sending goal coordinates from user (banana image coordinates). Value set by sendGoalCoors(int, int) and checked by update().

    • Method Detail

      • openPort

        public static void openPort()
        Override for SerialPort's openPort() method. Configures port and initiallizes values in data to non-null.

      • getRealCoors

        public static double[] getRealCoors()
        Currently an empty class, but eventually would be called by Gibbot.updateRealCoors() to animate the robot image. Type for coordinates could be changed to ints.
        Returns:
        double array of size 6 (x and y coors for each joint)

      • getData

        public static int[] getData()
        Returns data. Called by all graph animations.
        Returns:
        data The array with values for velocity, motor temp, battery, current, and torque.

      • update

        public static void update()
        Updates data. Called by GUILayeredPane in response to fires. As per communication protocol, sends a "q" to the other XBee and reads a stream of bytes that is returned. Turns the bytes into floats, scales as necessary, converts to ints and writes new values over old ones in data. If port is not open or if an error occurs while sending/ receiving, fills data with dummy values. Note that this does not return the array; getData() must be called for that.

      • sendGoalCoors

        public static void sendGoalCoors(int x,
                                 int y)
        Used to send user-determined goal coordinates to the robot. Called by BananaPanel1.mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent). Right now has port simply send coordinates as a string, but this is not final or necessary.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate to be reached by the robot
        y - Y coordinate to be reached by the robot
